author: greystroke
content:
A stealth address (used in Monero) is a one-time, unique address that is generated for every transaction. It is derived from the recipient’s public address but looks completely different each time. The transaction is then sent to this one-time address, not to the recipient’s actual public address. This means that if someone looks at the blockchain, they cannot tell who the real recipient is.

It is not a very high level of privacy,  but it provides a basic amount of privacy at the protocol level with a new private tx type.

author: greystroke
content: It is a high lindy method without the risk of hidden inflation bugs that more fully private protocol level tx types would entail.
